name: The Peabody Memphis

reviews.text: We stayed at the Peabody Aug 12th for one night on our tour of Civil War sites. The hotel surpassed my expectations. It was gracious, historic and beautiful, charming, and friendly. The ducks were so cute and performed on cue. The breakfast was excellent. The beds were comfortable and had a wealth of pillows. The self park was convenient, but when we checked out before breakfast, the staff allowed us to temporarily park in the turnaround area while we ate. The pool and hot tub were lovely.
reviews.title: Loved the Peabody!

likes.liked: — Beautiful with plenty of ramps and wonderful accessibility features
likes.disliked: — A bit weak in the category of urban fun outside the hotel proper

reviews.text: The memorabilia room was interesting. The historical character of the hotel was exquisite. We would recommend it for anyone interested in history and comfort!
reviews.title: Welcome to the South's Grand Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "Welcome to the South's Grand Hotel" is the line delivered by the Peabody Duckmaster before the start of the daily walking of the Peabody Ducks to spend their day in the lobby fountain.
reviews.title: Spectacular as usual

likes.disliked: — Light through the drapes, a little street noise

reviews.text: This is truly a Five Star Hotel. It is simply the nicest hotel at which I have ever stayed and would recommend it to anyone. The rooms are beautiful, bed and linens perfect. The lobby is a beautiful, grand old hotel. The service is absolutely incredible.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: Rooms are relatively expensive (about $300 when taxes and parking in the adjacent garage are factored in) but you still are receiving value for your money.
reviews.title: A lovely place to call home in The South

likes.disliked: — A bad room service meal on our second stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed qt the Peabody only for one night. The location is absolutely terrific - right near Beale Street and within walking distance to the Mighty Mississippi, but the room was on the small side and the bed as well.....as was the tiny bathroom........
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but room was just average!

likes.disliked: — The price of logging into the internet in the Business Center (a minimum of about $ 16.-- or more)

reviews.text: We got a coffee maker on demand and there was no minibar in the room - but otherwise everything was absolutely perfect. Did we get our money's worth?...... I don't know......
reviews.title: What a great place!

reviews.text: Staff was great. Room was cozy. Especialy the bed - very comfortable. Nice touches throughout room . Ducks were so cute. The roof patio/duck palace was fun. Did a lot of shopping at the various stores in the hotel. Great food too. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Stay away from rooms near service elavator

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, nice people. great music on roof Thursday nites. Just make sure you do not get room near the elevators, service one especially. Unbelievably loud. But gave me break on room when complained.....far from being worth a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Ask for an upgrade
Nickeled and Dimed
reviews.text: Visit Lansky's Men Shop in lobby. Clothier to Elvis in days past, now just very nice menswear and nice people. Mr Lansky's father, who started the biz, was the man responsible for The King's great costumes, etc.

reviews.title: Great platform to visit Beal Street
reviews.text: First off, you have to realize that this is an OLD hotel, and has its quirks. Elevators are a bit slow, floor plans a bit odd. But it is well kept, and quite charming. My room had an odd shape, but was large and comfortable. No noise issues. Had one meal there, and it was fine. Lots of cool restaurants within a block.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "walking of the ducks" is a big attraction, but I could have easily skipped it!
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: Beal Street is just a couple blocks away, and is a great place to visit for live music, good food, and bars with character.
reviews.title: Lub a Duck

reviews.text: One word of caution, walking to/from Beal, you will likely be hit up for money, perhaps in a not so friendly fashion. So, travel in groups at night, or take a cab. Once yuo get to Beal, there are plenty of cops and it feels very safe.
reviews.title: Overall a positive experience, but with a few negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good inner city hotel
reviews.title: Kudos All Around

likes.disliked: — The room looked a bit dated.

reviews.text: I stayed in Room 1114 on October 1 & 2, 2008 for a business conference.
reviews.title: One nice hotel!

likes.disliked: — Slow elevator, parking garage, panhandlers on the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good: This is a NICE hotel! The room is just the right size, the bed is very comfortable and the staff is very friendly. The lobby is a good place to read or people watch and the ducks in the fountain are cool. It is very classy. There are plenty of restaurants in the hotel and within walking distance too. The skyway top floor gives you a good view of downtown Memphis too. Make sure you go up there.
reviews.title: Lovely time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The not-so-good. Being old, the elevators are slow especially around 5PM when a lot of people were checking in. They add a $10 fee to your bill per day for the newspaper, lobby coffee and phone calls. Not cool. You can't deny this either. Parking is $16 per day and the parking lot is not close to the hotel. Use the front door drop off if you have a lot of bags.
reviews.title: Fit for a KING

likes.disliked: — There was nothing to dislike, as far as I was concerned

reviews.text: The bad: You can't go out on the street and walk anywhere without being hassled for money, cigarettes and one guy just started walking with me asking me where I was from, what am I doing in town etc. So, be careful and watch your pockets. Travel in groups if you can. Even if it is just to cross the street. This isn't the hotel's fault but it does effect your taste of Memphis.
reviews.title: Nearly Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights at the Peabody Memphis to celebrate our second honeymoon. The staff was excellent all the way around. Our room was quite small - the bathroom was TINY - but everything was spotlessly clean and fresh. Yes...it's a little noisy, being an older hotel. We found if we turned on the fan in the room it blocked out hallway noise. ONE NOTE: Our room was on the diagonal across from the Auto Zone ball park and it was very, VERY noisy outside when the music was blaring for the pre-game. Anyone considering staying here might think about requesting a room on the other side of the building.
reviews.title: Peabody is Wonderful!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the famous Peabody in late December 2008. On arrival we were treated great , The loby of the hotel is outstanding. It was fully decorated as you would expect for the festive period. Webooked a club room for the extra comfort and aminities, however, after experiencing the club floor at the Peninsular and the Four Seasons we were a little disapointed to say the least with the club floor experience. Our club room was a big size and everything was clean and as you would expect. It was the actual choice of food and drinks in the club lounge that didnt impress at all.
reviews.title: Loved the peabody with one reservation
Memphis - Peabody Hotel
reviews.text: We loved the service , and the friendlyness of the attendants in the club area, but to be honest it was not worth the extra money.
Loved the hotel & the ducks, and to be honest if we ever returned to Memphis it is in my opinion the only place to stay, but I would definatly not spend the extra on a club room at this hotel.
reviews.title: Not bad, love the ducks

reviews.text: The Peabody Hotel in Memphis is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Great stay at this historic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is exquisite with fresh flowers and a twice daily live duck parade complete with a duck master and music. It is so much fun to see the ducks and everyone having a good time.
reviews.title: A blast into the 1950's

reviews.text: The Peabody is a pretty neat, but old, hotel. I heard it was originally built in the 1800's, though don't know for sure. The rooms are clearly quite old but pretty well updated and reasonably nice. Our rooms weren't ready until after 5 pm which may have just been a fluke, but we were with a convention and they may have just been overloaded with check-in. The service was really good, the staff very friendly with all the polite Southern charm you would come to expect. The ducks in the lobby are an interesting gag and is the unique identity of the hotel.
reviews.title: Peabody is kind of neat but pretty old

reviews.text: Overall, a pleasant place for a business function and probably a good place for pleasure as well.
reviews.title: You're Missing Out!

reviews.text: All the harsh criticism about the Peabody and Chez Phillipe is hard to believe. I guess it all depends on your attitude. I am a frequent business and lesuire traveler. When it comes to food I don't cut corners. As we all know, price never guarantees a great meal. With that being said, my wife and I got 5 star treatment at the Peabody & Chez Phillipe. The Peabody blows away the St. Francis in San Francisco. The people in Memphis are the nicest around. Our 7 course meal and wine pairing rivaled that of Cyrus in Healdsburg, CA. We made personal friends w/ Jason the Peabody Duck Master. I recommend heading to the Skyway and watch the ducks head down to the lobby versus waiting in the lobby with the masses to watch the ducks arrive or head up.If you think the ducks are over-rated than you don't appreciate the history of the Peabody. Our room was spacious. The bed was comfy. The service was second to none. The bottom line is that there will always be people that find fault in everything. My wife and I find the time to to go out of our way to be friendly with everyone on staff. Guess what? They bend over backwards in return. You catch more flys with honey than with vinegar. I highly recommend the Peabody & Chez Phillipe.
reviews.title: When in Memphis stay at the Peabody!

likes.liked: — The comfy beds and the service.
likes.disliked: — Didn't get the king superior room that I booked.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds could not be any more comfortable and the service is supreme!!! We even had a celebrity sighting. For a great breakfast, head to the Blue Plate Cafe which is about 2 -3 blocks from the hotel. And, of course, the ducks are cute!
reviews.title: Rude check -in staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I along with another couple recently spent 3 nights at the Peabody. Our first impression was WOW- what a beautiful lobby! We had arrived early and since check-in is at 4:00, our rooms were not ready (our friend's room was ready, however). We were told that housekeeping would get on it immediately while we had lunch. Two hours later, our room was still not ready. The front desk was so rude and actually blamed our travel agent for the problem. The problem was that a huge convention was checking in and that was their priority. They finally gave us a room but not the room we paid for. The king deluxe room that we reserved turned into a small standard room near the elevator. Well, 3 rooms and 2 hours later, we finally got the room we booked. It was a large corner room with a nice sitting area. The only negative with the room was the fact that the small closet was in the already small bathroom.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere, local flavor, so-so rooms
Peabody Hotel .. excellent service and location
reviews.text: My mum and I stayed at the Peabody Hotel from 13-17 Nov. It was my mum's 60th birthday just a few days before and I mentioned this on my booking with the hotel. Upon check-in my mum was greeted with a very sincere "Happy Birthday" from the female receptionist who had reserved a large corner Superior room for us with 2 double beds and 2 large windows. The beds were so comfortable!

This attention to detail was evident in most areas of the hotel from check-in, the appearance of the general areas, the quality of the rooms and the housekeeping staff. I feel the hotel service was only let down on 1 occasion when the barman in the Lobby Bar was rather surly whilst serving us (this I believe was due to the overly fussy and complaining customer he served just before us, but that's no excuse!).
reviews.title: Beautiful Foyer, lovely room, but expensive..

reviews.text: The Concierge was excellent at arranging transport at very short notice to take us to and from Gracelands in a private hire car. Our female driver was extremely friendly and very flexible with our return time to the hotel. In my opinion, the cost of the journey was cheaper than had we taken taxis to and from the home of Elvis.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.disliked: — Unfriendly staff at reception, one point they mocked us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Peabody Duck March at 11am is a must-see - the hotel has this so well organised that we were able to see it all despite the crowds of people from external tours that appeared in the lobby about 10.45am.
reviews.title: Beautiful and luxurious!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Beale Street which I highly recommend, there's so many bars and places to eat to choose from. We encountered only 1 hawker outside the Peabody Hotel on our very first evening but that's probably because we came out the side door without planning our route to Beale Street beforehand and he could see we were new to the city.
reviews.title: A little noisy but lots of character

likes.liked: — Size and decor of the room

reviews.text: This was beautiful! Every detail was perfect. It was clean, bright, cheery. They have a duck theme going on (google the story, its worth it!) so there were duckson the bathmat, ducks on the sheets, ducks on the roof. The bed was soft. The clerks were helpful. My only complaint is I had to leave before the ducks in the lobby.
reviews.title: Beautiful little gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel and location. Parking is $16 a day or $21 for valet parking. We were charged $9.95 per person for the use of internet (did not need), newspaper, fittness area (who's kidding, we were on Holiday!) and coffee in the lobby from 5-7am (which we slept through). I felt this was unfair and especially for the 2 of us( to be charged) in the same room.
reviews.title: Check local sports schedule prior to reservation

likes.liked: — The atmoshere of an old grand hotel, esp. the Sunday Brunch!
likes.disliked: — The delayed check-in and the way the staff handeled it

reviews.title: Wonderful Girls Weekend
reviews.text: We arrived for check in at 4pm but did not get our room until 7pm. This was due to the local university basketball team occupying the rooms for their HOME game that was rescheduled from afternoon time to a night game.
We found the front desk staff as well as the manager on duty unconcerned, very hard to understand the accent of the lady assisting us. The nicest staff were the bellmen, and the door men.
reviews.title: My favorite hotel
Beautiful, fine, genteel hotel
reviews.text: Recommend the Sunday Brunch, great!

description: Historic, luxury hotel located in downtown Memphis, TN, known for its famous marching mallards, The Peabody Ducks. Located just two blocks from the world-famous Beale Street entertainment district, Peabody Place, Memphis Museum of Rock & Soul, FedEx Forum and Autozone Park.
